wikipedia_page.main:
David Blaine McGregor (7 February 1909 – unknown) was a British water polo player who competed in the 1936 Summer Olympics.
He was part of the British team which finished eighth in the 1936 tournament. He played three matches.
His son, Bob McGregor, competed as a swimmer at the 1964 and 1968 Summer Olympics, winning a silver medal in the 100 metres freestyle event in 1964.

He retired from swimming in 1968 and now works as an architect in Glasgow.  He lives in Helensburgh with his wife and family.  His father, David McGregor, was an Olympic water polo player.
